intro: Dianthus monadelphus subsp. monadelphus, commonly known as the common carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces fragrant, five-petaled blooms. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. This species is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and floral arrangements.
